Question: At the Country Disc Jockey Convention in early November, this person was voted the year's most promising male artist.
Hints: Between 1977 and 1981, six posthumously released singles by this person were top ten country hits.
At the end of the show, Sullivan declared this person "a real decent, fine boy".
In September 1941, this person entered first grade at East Tupelo Consolidated, where his instructors regarded him as "average".
